James Madison
James Madison was a United States President, the successor of Thomas Jefferson.
When Meriwether Lewis died, he had been en route to deliver evidence of General James Wilkinson's treachery to Madison and Jefferson.
Behind the scenes
James Madison (March 16, 1751 – June 28, 1836) was the fourth President of the United States. One of the nation's Founding Fathers, he is known specifically as the "Father of the Constitution" due to his prominent contributions to the United States Constitution and Bill of Rights.
